revised_title: Determination of the Obliquity of the Ecliptic and the Maximum of the Aberration of Light
tldr: The author presents the results of observations made at Trinity College Observatory in Dublin to determine the obliquity of the ecliptic and the maximum of the aberration of light. The study compares the results from summer solstices and winter solstices, discussing the impact of refraction and the importance of further observations to refine the measurements.
